DQC.US.0001.name: Axis with Inappropriate Members
description: DQC.US 0001 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis: the axis that is the subject of this rule
axis-descendants: Yes if UGT descendents are allowed as members, else None
additional-axes: array of additional axes whose UGT descendants are allowed members
additional-members: array of additional UGT members allowed
unallowed-axes: array of additional axes whose UGT descendants are allowed members
extensions-allowed: Yes, No or Limited
extension-members: array of limited extension member names
child-extension-members: array of extension members whose children are allowed
axis-default-must-match-UGT: Yes - extension axis default must match UGT default
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0001/DQC_0001_ListOfAxes.xlsx
also see: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0001/DQC_0001.md
DQC.US.0001.message-unreported: Member defined for the axis {axis} was not reported with any fact: {member}
DQC.US.0001.message-disallowed-default: Default defined for the axis {axis}, {default}, should be {allowedDefault}

62.comment: add dei currency members for 2024 per CP XBRL-US

75.comment: DQC implementation additionally notes in message when disallowed member is also in the StatementClassOfStockAxis

DQC.US.0004.name: Element Values Are Equal
description: DQC.US 0004 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
sum: local name of the sum fact
items: array of local name(s) of the items which add up to the sum (within tolerance)
blocking-axes: array of local name(s) of axes which, if any is present, block this check from running
alternatives: object whose keys are alternatives for item and values an array of
alternatives arrays of items to sum for substitution,
or an alternative of sum for substitution (single item in list for sum substitute),
calc-sum: local name of a calculation summation item to be used instead if available
calc-items: local names of calculation items required if using calc instead of sum/items above
tolerance: integer representing 10**-leastDecimals*tolerance for equality margin)
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0004/DQC_0004.md

DQC.US.0005.name: Context Dates After Period End Date
description: DQC.US 0005 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
name: local name of the fact
axis: local name of axis
member: local name of axis member
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0005/DQC_0005.md
DQC searches for latest document period end date but EDGAR uses required context and header value instead

17.name: EntityCommonStockSharesOutstanding

description: DQC.US 0006 rule entries are formatted is as follows:

axis: local name of axis
member: local name of axis member
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0005/DQC_0006.md

DQC.US.0008.name: Reversed Calculation
description: DQC.US 0008 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and empty value object
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_00098DQC_0008.md
DQC.US.0008.message: The calculation in the extension taxonomy from {conceptFrom} to {conceptTo} in {linkroleDefinition} is the opposite of a calculation defined in the base US GAAP taxonomy. Check that the calculation is correct or that you have used the correct tag for the two elements identified in the calculation. It is possible that the calculation is correct in the case of a reconciliation calculation.

DQC.US.0009.name: Element A must be less than or equal to Element B
description: DQC.US 0009 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
lesser: local name of the fact which must be lesser than or equal
greater: local name of the fact which must be greater than lesser fact
use-message: optional message specific to this rule to override general message
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0009/DQC_0009.md

DQC.US.0013.name: Negative Values With Dependence

A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value which is name of
elements which may be negative when the precondition is met.
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0013/DQC_0013.md

DQC.US.0014.name: Negative Values With No Dimensions
description: DQC.US 0014 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value which is name of
elements which may be negative when the precondition is met.
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0014/DQC_0014.md
taken from v22 documentation xslx

DQC.US.0015.name: Negative Values
description: DQC.US 0015 rule entries based on the DQCRT taxonomy rule 0015 entries specifying facts and rule IDs.
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0015/DQC_0015.md
excluded-concept-typed-dimensions is a dict by concept localname of type dim localnames which when present exclude from nonneg test

DQC.US.0033.name: Document Period End Date Context
description: DQC.US 0033 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
Precondition emulates xule precondition expression, first entry
where first fact binds returns sum of all bound facts
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
names: local name of DEI facts to test
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0033/DQC_0033.md

DQC.US.0036.name: Document Period End Date Context Fact Value Check
description: DQC.US 0036 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0036/DQC_0036.md

DQC.US.0041.name: Axis with a Default Member that Differs from the Base Taxonomy
description: DQC.US 0041 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
parent-name: local name of summation concept to test relationships to item concepts
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0041/DQC_0041.md
DQC.US.0041.message: The dimension default defined for the axis in the base taxonomy should not be changed in a company extension taxonomy. The default for the {axisName} in the base taxonomy is {axisDefaultName}, but the default has been replaced with {extensionDefaultName}

DQC.US.0043.name: Incorrect Calculation Weights in Operating Cash Flows
description: DQC.US 0043 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
parent-name: local name of summation concept to test relationships to item concepts
excluded-name: local names of descendants to be excluded from rule
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0043/DQC_0043.md

message.credit:
The concept {bottomName} is included in the calculation of {topName} in role {linkrole}.  {bottomName} is a credit balance type concept representing a natural cash outflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to {topName}. 

A credit balance type concept should always be assigned a negative one (-1) calculation weight as it is a deduction from net income (loss) to reconcile to {topName}.{bottomName} has been incorrectly provided a positive one (+1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. 

Correct the calculation weight to negative one (-1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is a deduction of a non-cash income or gain, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability. If the value is an add-back of a non-cash expense or loss, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability and {bottomName} is the correct concept, input a negative value.
message.debit:
The concept {bottomName} is included in the calculation of {topName} in role {linkrole}.  {bottomName} is a debit balance type concept representing a natural cash inflow in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to {topName}. 

A debit balance type concept should always be assigned a positive one (+1) calculation weight as it is an addition to net income (loss) to reconcile to {topName}.{bottomName} has been incorrectly provided a negative one (-1) calculation weight in the extension taxonomy. 

Correct the calculation weight to positive one (+1) and input the value as a positive amount if it is an addition of a non-cash expense or loss, a decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability. If the value is an increase in an asset or a decrease in a liability and {bottomName} is the correct concept, input a negative value.
message:
The concept {bottomName} is included in the calculation of {topName} in role {linkrole}.  {bottomName} does not have a balance type attribute. 

If {bottomName}, by definition, represents a natural cash inflow (i.e., a non-cash add-back, decrease in an asset, or an increase in a liability) in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to {topName}, then the concept should be given a positive one (+1) calculation weight. 

If {bottomName}, by definition, represents a natural cash outflow (i.e., a non-cash reduction, an increase in an asset, or a decrease in a liability) in the reconciliation of net income (loss) to {topName}, then the concept should be given a negative one (-1) calculation weight. 

The significant portion of values input to the Instance are expected to be absolute; the values are debits or credits, not positive or negative. As there is no balance type attribute, the positive input would represent the value that is consistent with the substance of the concept, as defined.

message.neg: The company has reported the concept {name} as part of the cash flow statement. This income item is being deducted from the value of operating cash flows in the calculation defined by the filer.  This implies that the resulting operating cash flow calculation excludes this income item from cash flow from operations.  If  {name} represents income from discontinued operations then the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations should be used as the total rather than the current total element of NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities. If the item is an income item and is being deducted because the value is negative then consider changing the sign and weight of the element.
message.pos: The company has reported the concept {name} as part of the cash flow statement. This income item is being added to the value of operating cash flows in the calculation defined by the filer.  This implies that the resulting operating cash flow calculation includes this income item in cash flow from operations.  If {name} represents income from discontinued operations then the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivities should be used as the total rather than the current total element of  NetCashProvidedByUsedInOperatingActivitiesContinuingOperations.

DQC.US.0044.name: Accrual Items used in Investing or Financing Cash Flow Reconciliation
description: DQC.US 0044 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
parent-name: local name of summation concept to test relationships to item concepts
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0044/DQC_0044.md

DQC.US.0045.name: Movement of Concepts between Calculation Trees
description: DQC.US 0045 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
us-gaap: local name of summation parent concept in us-gaap
extension: local name of summation parent concept in extension
cash-flow-exceptions: local names of exceptions
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0045/DQC_0045.md

6835.message: The concept {name} appears in the investing cash flows of the company's cash flow statement. {name} is an operating item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow generated from operating activities.  Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item.

6836.message: The concept {name} appears in the investing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. {name} is a financing item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow generated from financing activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item.

6837.message: The concept {name} appears in the financing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. {name} is an investing item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow generated from investing activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item.

6838.message: The concept {name} appears in the financing cashflows of the companies cash flow statement. {name} is an operating item and it is expected that this item would only appear in the cash flow from operating activities. Please review the calculations defined for the cash flow statement to determine that the correct element has been used for this item.

DQC.US.0046.name: Inappropriate Calculation Descendent
description: DQC.US 0046 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
sum: local name of summation concept in extension
item: local name of descendant concept in extension
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0046/DQC_0046.md

6839.message:
The element NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Continuing Operations) does not include EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalents (Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash and Cash Equivalents) as defined in the US GAAP Taxonomy.

However, in the companies extension taxonomy NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations includes EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalents as a summation-child. Consider using either CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease or CashPeriodIncreaseDecrease, instead of NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations.

6840.message:
The element NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Continuing Operations) does not include EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalentsContinuingOperations (Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash and Cash Equivalents, Continuing Operations) as defined in the US GAAP Taxonomy.

However, in the companies extension taxonomy NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations includes EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalentsContinuingOperations as a summation-child. Consider using either CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease or CashPeriodIncreaseDecrease,  instead of NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations.

6841.message:
The element NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Continuing Operations) does not include EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents (Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash and Cash Equivalents, Restricted Cash and Restricted Cash Equivalents) as defined in the US GAAP Taxonomy.

However, in the companies extension taxonomy NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations includes EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalents as a summation-child. Consider using either CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease or CashPeriodIncreaseDecrease,  instead of NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations.

6842.message:
The element CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect (Cash and Cash Equivalents, Period Increase (Decrease), Excluding Exchange Rate Effect) does not include EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalents (Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash and Cash Equivalents) as defined in the US GAAP Taxonomy.

However, in the companies extension taxonomy CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect includes EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalents as a summation-child. Consider using either CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease or CashPeriodIncreaseDecrease,  instead of CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect.

7480.message:
The element NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations (Net Cash Provided by (Used in) Discontinued Operations) does not include EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalentsDiscontinuedOperations (Effect of Exchange Rate on Cash and Cash Equivalents, Discontinued Operations) as defined in the US GAAP Taxonomy.

However, in the companies extension taxonomy NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations includes EffectOfExchangeRateOnCashAndCashEquivalentsDiscontinuedOperations as a summation-child. Consider using either CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease or CashPeriodIncreaseDecrease,  instead of NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations.

9279.message: The element NetIncomeLoss (Net Income Loss) should not be included as a total of {totals}. The OCI element represents Other Comprehensive Income and should be aggregated with NetIncome Loss to derive the value of Comprehensive Income. Please remove Net Income Loss from the calculation, or change  the total to be a Comprehensive Income element such as ComprehensiveIncomeNetOfTaxIncludingPortionAttributableToNoncontrollingInterest. (Comprehensive Income (Loss), Net of Tax, Including Portion Attributable to Noncontrolling Interest).

DQC.US.0047.name: Calculation Descendants with No Balance Type
description: DQC.US 0047 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and parents is an array of element name(s)
of which at there should be no children without a balance attribute
excepting those in excluded-children.
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0047/DQC_0047.md
DQC.US.0047.message: In the company's extension taxonomy the concept {parentName} includes {childName} as a summation-child. The concept {childName}  should not appear as a child of {parentName} because it does not have a balance type. Increase (Decrease) items without balance attributes are used in a roll forward and should not be used in the cash flow statement as they represent the impact on the balance sheet item which is the opposite of the impact on cash.

DQC.US.0048.name: Required Calculation Parent Element in the Cash Flow Statement
description: DQC.US 0048 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and roots is an array of element name(s)
of which at least one of the element name(s) choices must be a calculation root.
Where there are two names in a choice both must be roots for the choice to match.
Rule is skipped for excluded-document-types or any of blocking-facts
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0048/DQC_0048.md
DQC.US.0048.message:
The filing should include in the cash flow statement calculation linkbase(s) {linkRole} - {linkroleDefinition} one of the following elements as the root(first element) of the calculation tree to represent the aggregate change in cash for the period:


CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect,
CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect, 
NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (As long as the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations is also included the reconciliation between opening and closing cash). 
The calculation linkbase in the filing has the following root elements defined: {rootNames}
DQC.US.0048.message-no-roles:
The filing should include in the cash flow statement calculation linkbase(s) one of the following elements as the root(first element) of the calculation tree to represent the aggregate change in cash for the period: 


CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect, 
CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect, 
NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (As long as the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations is also included the reconciliation between opening and closing cash). 
The calculation linkbase in the filing has no relationships for the role(s): {linkRoles}

DQC.US.0051.name: Before Tax Items
description: DQC.US 0051 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
concepts: local name of summation concept in extension
tax-items: local name of descendant concept in extension
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0051/DQC_0051.md
DQC.US.0051.message: {taxConcept} should not be included in the calculation of {concept} in the group {linkRole}. {concept} is before the deduction of tax. Excluding the tax expense from the amount is inconsistent with the meaning of the element  because this element represents a before tax item and should not be used to represent an after tax item. If {concept} represents the amount after tax then use NetIncomeLoss instead.

DQC.US.0052.name: Member Values
description: DQC.US 0052 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis: local name of axis which cannot be tagged with a value
member: local name of member which cannot be tagged with a value
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0052/DQC_0052.md
DQC.US.0052.message: The element {name} with a value of {value} has been used with the axis RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis and the member DomesticPlanMember. The DomesticPlanMember element is not intended to be used in the instance document, instead the specific country from the SEC's Country Taxonomy is intended to tag the information.

DQC.US.0053.name: Excluded Members from an Axis
description: DQC.US 0053 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and an object
of dimensions name key whose value array are excluded member names.
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0053/DQC_0053.md
DQC.US.0053.message: The member, {member} is used on the {axis} with element {factName} with a value of ${value}. The  {member} member should not be used with the {axis} in linkrole {linkRole}.
DQC.US.0053.message-no-facts: The member, {member} is used on the {axis}.  There are no facts associated with this member and axis. {member} members should not be used with the {axis} in linkrole {linkRole}.

DQC.US.0054.name: Excluded Dimensions from a Table
description: DQC.US 0054 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
table: local name of table concept
axis: local name of axis concept
message: message specific to this situation
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0054/DQC_0054.md

7490.message: The definition linkbase in the extension taxonomy defines the axis Statement Geographical Axis as an axis of  the table Schedule Of Defined Benefit Plans Disclosures [Table]. This axis cannot be used on this table as this axis is expressly prohibited from being used on this table by the 2017 FASB taxonomy and retirement benefits implementation guide.  Consider using the axis Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] instead.

7491.message: The definition linkbase in the extension taxonomy defines the axis Statement Geographical Axis as an axis of  the table Defined Contribution Plan [Table]. This axis cannot be used on this table as this axis is expressly prohibited from being used on this table by the 2017 FASB taxonomy and retirement benefits implementation guide.  Consider using the axis Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] instead.

7492.message: The definition linkbase in the extension taxonomy defines the axis Statement Geographical Axis as an axis of  the table Defined Benefit Plans and Other Postretirement Benefit Plans Disclosures [Table]. This axis cannot be used on this table as this axis is expressly prohibited from being used on this table by the 2017 FASB taxonomy and retirement benefits implementation guide.  Consider using the axis Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] instead.

DQC.US.0055.name: Required Member on An Axis
description: DQC.US 0055 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis: local name of axis concept
required-memgers: local names of required members
requires-children: local names of members requiring children
message: message specific to this situation
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0055/DQC_0055.md

7493.message:
Neither the  Domestic Plan [Member] NOR Foreign Plan [Member] has been used on the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] in the presentation linkbase {linkrole}. The FASB requires that either one or both of these members is present on the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis]. Please review the axis and add one of these members or assess the need to use the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis].

The axis RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis has the following members listed under it: {members}.

9842.message:
For the path including the elements {members} neither the  Domestic Plan [Member] NOR Foreign Plan [Member] has been included in the path of the descendants of the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] in the presentation linkbase  {linkrole}. The FASB requires that either one or both of these members is present on the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis]. Please review the axis and add one of these members or assess the need to use the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis].

The axis RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis has the following members listed under it for this path: {members}.

9843.message:
The Domestic Plan [Member] has been included as a descendant of the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] in the presentation linkbase {linkrole}. The FASB requires that this member includes children elements representing the Domestic Geography. In this case the Domestic Plan [Member] has no children. Please add a member representing the domestic location or remove the Domestic Plan [Member].

The axis RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis has the following members listed under it for this path: {members}.

9844.message:
The Foreign Plan [Member] has been included as a descendant of the Retirement Plan Sponsor Location [Axis] in the presentation linkbase {linkrole}. The FASB requires that this member includes children elements representing the Foreign Geography if no value is reported for the foreign plan member if no value is reported for the foreign plan member. In this case the Foreign Plan [Member] has no children. Please add a member representing the foreign location or remove the Foreign Plan [Member].

The axis RetirementPlanSponsorLocationAxis has the following members listed under it for this path: {members}.

DQC.US.0057.name: Cash Flow Opening and Closing Balances
description: DQC.US 0057 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and an object
containing set of must-be-present-elements and message.
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0057/DQC_0057.md

7494.message: One of the following elements {elementNames} should appear as the opening and closing balance in the cash flow statement using the group {role}. Instead the following balance items have been used in this statement {balanceElements}. Depending if ASU-2016-18 has been adopted at least one of the opening and closing balance items listed must be used in the cash flow statement.

9728.message: One of the following elements {elementNames} should appear as the opening and closing balance in the cash flow statement using the group {role}. Instead the following balance items have been used in this statement {balanceElements}. Due to the implementaion of ASU-2016-18 at least one of the opening and closing balance items listed must be used in the cash flow statement.

DQC.US.0060.name: Element Dependence for Specific Elements
description: DQC.US 0060 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
key is element, value is array of corresponding dependent elements
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0060/DQC_0060.md

DQC.US.0061.name: Cash Flow Continuing Operations Elements not Used
description: DQC.US 0061 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
net-cash and dscontin-cash (discontinued) per rule
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0061/DQC_0061.md
DQC.US.0061.message: The taxonomy extension includes {netCash} and {discontinCash} in the calculation of {commonAncestor}. But {discontinCash} is not a direct child of {netCash}. {netCash} is intended to represent the total of cash provided by or used in continuing and discontinued operations. Cash flows from both Discontinued operations and Investing activities cannot add into the total of {commonAncestor} as this implies that discontinued operations is being double counted, once in investing activities and once as discontinued operations.

DQC.US.0062.name: No Fact Value for Change in Cash
description: DQC.US 0062 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
change in cash elements per rule
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0062/DQC_0062.md
DQC.US.0062.message:
The filing includes a cash flow statement in the role {linkroles}, but does not report a value for the change in cash using any of the following elements:

CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffect (After adoption of ASU-2016-18)
CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect (After adoption of ASU-2016-18)
CashPeriodIncreaseDecrease (Prior to adoption of ASU-2016-18)
CashPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect (Prior to adoption of ASU-2016-18)
CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecrease  (Prior to adoption of ASU-2016-18)
CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffectContinuingOperations
CashCashEquivalentsRestrictedCashAndRestrictedCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseIncludingExchangeRateEffectDisposalGroupIncludingDiscontinuedOperations
CashAndCashEquivalentsPeriodIncreaseDecreaseExcludingExchangeRateEffect (Prior to adoption of ASU-2016-18) or 
NetCashProvidedByUsedInContinuingOperations (As long as the element NetCashProvidedByUsedInDiscontinuedOperations is also included the reconciliation between opening and closing cash)

If you have disclosed a change in cash for the period, one of the above elements should be used.  Please update your filing if one of the following has occurred:

1. The change in cash has not been represented with a value, in this case the element should be tagged with a value of zero.
2. The change in cash flow is dimensionally qualified with an inappropriate dimension. The instance should have a value reported with no dimensions. The rule will identify where the successor member has been used or an extension member. The value for change in cash should not have a dimension.
3. The change in cash has been represented with an extension element. There is no reason the change in cash needs to be identified using an extension element.

DQC.US.0065.name: Interest Paid Net (Operating) Not on Cash Flow

based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0065/DQC_0065.md

description: DQC.US 0069 rule entries are formatted is as follows:

DQC.US.0070.name: Plan Asset Dimensional Aggregation
description: DQC.US 0070 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis-qname, array of primary-items-names
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0071/DQC_0071.md
DQC.US.0070.message:
The concept {name} with a defaulted value of {value} is not equal to the aggregated value of the dimensionally qualified components on the axis DefinedBenefitPlanByPlanAssetCategoriesAxis which has an aggregate value of {mbrSum} based on the data in the filing. 
The aggregated value is calculated by adding the members in the network {linkroleUri}. The values of the calculation components are as follows:
{mbrStr}.  

The value of a concept broken down by its components along the DefinedBenefitPlanByPlanAssetCategoriesAxis axis should  be equal to its component pieces. An error could occur for one of the following reasons:  

1. The values of the plan assets by category have been further disaggregated by additional dimensions such as geography. Plan Asset categories should not be dimensionally disaggregated and members should be defined for each security class reported. i.e. Equity Securities in the US should be represented as a single member.  

2. The  default value of {name} is incorrectly totaled for DefinedBenefitPlanFairValueOfPlanAssets  

 3. Not all dimension members or additional dimensions have been defined on the category axis DefinedBenefitPlanByPlanAssetCategoriesAxis.  

4. The filer has reported a sub component of plan assets that does not represent a complete breakdown of the total. In these cases the element DefinedBenefitPlanPlanAssetsInvestmentWithinPlanAssetCategoryAmount should be used instead of the element DefinedBenefitPlanFairValueOfPlanAssets.  

This rule aggregates the value of member components located on the axis at the highest level of aggregation to avoid double counting in the event that the company uses a hierarchy of members.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0071.name: Revenue/Cost Single Member
description: DQC.US 0071 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis-qname, array of primary-items-names
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0071/DQC_0071.md
DQC.US.0071.message:
The filing has reported a value for the element {name} with a value of {value} using the ProductOrServiceAxis in the role {role} on the table {table}. However, the only member used to disaggregate the total for {name} was the member {member}. If only one member is used on this axis then the filer should either: 

1. Retag the filing using the element TypeOfRevenueExtensibleList/TypeOfCostGoodOrServiceExtensibleList with a value of {member} and the member {member} should be removed from the value as it represents the aggregate value of {name}; or 

2. Tag the aggregate value of {name} with a value of {value} without the product of service axis. This rule will not generate an error if the aggregate value of {name} is reported.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

axis-qname, array of primary-items-names
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0072/DQC_0072.md

7647.name: DefinedBenefitPlanPlanAssetsInvestmentWithinPlanAssetCategoryPercentage
7647.message-missing-dim:
The element {name} with a value of {value} must be used with the dimension DefinedBenefitPlanByPlanAssetCategoriesAxis.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.
7647.message-axis-child:
It is expected that the concept {name} with a value of {value} should not be a direct child of DefinedBenefitPlanByPlanAssetCategoriesAxis.  The element {$ComponentAmount.concept} is supposed to be used as a  component of DefinedBenefitPlanFairValueOfPlanAssets with a more specific member.  This member should appear on the DefinedBenefitPlanByPlanAssetCategoriesAxis as a child of the member used to report the value for DefinedBenefitPlanFairValueOfPlanAssets.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0073.message:
The concept {name} with a value of {value} is used with the DefinedBenefitPlanByPlanAssetCategoriesAxis. This element cannot be used with this axis.   

The properties of this {name} fact are:

The allowable list of elements that can be used are as follows: {allowableNames}.

DQC.US.0077.message:

This axis must be used when reporting a value for {name}. Please refer to the FASB implementation guide on Revenue from Contracts with Customers on the FASB website.

array of acceptable dimension axes names
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0078/DQC_0078.md
DQC.US.0078.message:
The filer has reported a value for the element {name} with a value of {value} without using the axis OwnershipAxis. This axis must be used when reporting a value for {name}. Please refer to the FASB implementation guide on Dimensional Modeling for Disclosures of Consolidated and Nonconsolidated Entities on the FASB website. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID}

description: DQC.US 0079 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:

DQC.US.0079.message: {member} is an extension member on the axis {axis} that was reported in the extension taxonomy, but duplicates a concept, {replacement}, that exists in the SEC Non-GAAP taxonomies.

DQC.US.0084.name: Durational Aggregation
description: DQC.US 0084 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis, array of allowable-primary-item names
tolerance: integer representing 10**-leastDecimals*tolerance for equality margin)
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0084/DQC_0084.md
DQC.US.0084.message:
Sum of the cumulative periods of {sumPeriods} for {name} does not match the reported total of {value}, a difference of {difference}.  

Period values are:
{periods}

This rule takes into account possible rounding of values across periods and the decimals associated with each fact. This rule used a tolerance of {tolerance} which is calculated by taking the lowest decimal value used in the calculation of {minDecimals}. If there is a difference between the sum of the periods and the aggregate value reported the difference may be due to incorrect decimals associated with the individual fact values. The filer should check that the fact values do not have a decimal value that implies a higher level of accuracy than intended.

In those rare cases where there are small immaterial differences that are less than 1% of the total and decimals are zero the rule can be overidden. This is performed by creating an extension element called ImmaterialDifferenceFlag.  If this element has any value in any context in the instance then the immaterial difference will not result in an error.  

The rule excludes elements in the base taxonomy that cannot be aggregated such as an average, maximum or minimum value.   

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0085.name: Deferred Tax Assets & Liabilities
description: DQC.US 0085 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
network: specifies if checking pre financial statement, calc parents or a specific calc ancestor
incorrect-concepts: these should not be on a financial statement
incorrect-ancestor: should not be an ancestor of {name} in a calc network
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0085/DQC_0085.md

9361.network: should not be on pre financial statement
9361.message: The element {incorrectConcept} appears in the face financial statements of the filing {linkrole}.  This element is a footnote concept that should only be used in a footnote disclosure.  To report the value of deferred taxes on the balance sheet either the element DeferredIncomeTaxAssetsNet or DeferredIncomeTaxLiabilitiesNet should be used depending if it is a liability or an asset. If the value of {incorrectConcept} is the same as the value for DeferredIncomeTaxAssetsNet or DeferredIncomeTaxLiabilitiesNet, then one of these balance sheet elements should be used on the balance sheet and not the footnote element {incorrectConcept}.

9362.name: DeferredIncomeTaxAssetsNet
9362.message:
The element {name} with a value {value} does not appear in a calculation defined in the filing.  This concept is a balance sheet item and should appear on the balance sheet or as a component of a balance sheet item in the footnotes.  If this value is the amount with jurisdictional netting and it is reported in the footnotes then the value of DeferredTaxAssetsNet (the amount without jurisdictional netting) should also be reported. To resolve the error the element DeferredIncomeTaxAssetsNet needs to be either included with the Balance Sheet Location Axis or be included in a calculation with Assets as an ancestor.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

9363.name: DeferredIncomeTaxLiabilitiesNet
9363.message:
The element {name} with a value {value} does not appear in a calculation defined in the filing.  This concept is a balance sheet item and should appear on the balance sheet or as a component of a balance sheet item in the footnotes.  If this value is the amount with jurisdictional netting and it is reported in the footnotes then the value of DeferredTaxLiabilities (the amount without jurisdictional netting) should also be reported. To resolve the error the element DeferredIncomeTaxLiabilitiesNet needs to either be included with the Balance Sheet Location Axis or be included in a calculation with Liabilities as an ancestor.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

9364.name: DeferredTaxAssetsNet
9364.message:
The element {name} has been reported with a value of {value}, this element is also included as a calculation descendant of {ancestor} in the financial statements. This element is a footnote element and should not appear in the face financial statements.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

9365.name: DeferredTaxAssetsLiabilitiesNet
9365.message:
The element {name} has been reported with a value of {value}, this element is also included as a calculation descendant of {ancestor} in the financial statements. This element is a footnote element and should not appear in the face financial statements.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

9367.name: DeferredTaxLiabilities
9367.message:
The element {name} has been reported with a value of {value}, this element is also included as a calculation descendant of {ancestor} in the financial statements. This element is a footnote element and should not appear in the face financial statements.  

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0089.name: Invalid Elements Used On Range Axis
description: DQC.US 0089 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis, array of allowable-primary-item names
tolerance: integer representing 10**-leastDecimals*tolerance for equality margin)
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0084/DQC_0084.md
DQC.US.0089.message:
The element {name} with a value of {value} has been reported in the filing using the range axis. This element cannot be used with the range axis. To record the range of remaining lease terms use the US GAAP element called LesseeOperatingLeaseRemainingLeaseTerm for operating leases and the US GAAP element called LesseeFinanceLeaseRemainingLeaseTerm for finance leases. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0090.name: Incorrect Calculation of Operating Lease Liability Payments Due
description: DQC.US 0090 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis, array of allowable-primary-item names
tolerance: integer representing 10**-leastDecimals*tolerance for equality margin)
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0090/DQC_0090.md

9374.message:
The element {name} with a value of {sumValue} should be equal to the sum of OperatingLeaseLiability plus LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityUndiscountedExcessAmount. The value of these adds to {addendValue}.  A difference of {differenceValue}. In an annual filing this reconciliation is required and all elements should have a value in the current reporting period.  

If the difference is due to an extension reconciliation item, then the filer should add a calculation relationship. The calculation tree should show the parent element as LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue with children of LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityUndiscountedExcessAmount + OperatingLeaseLiability + any extension items. There should already be a calculation tree defined for the components of LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue comprised of LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDueNextTwelveMonths +  LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDueYearTwo etc.  These two beakdowns of LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue should be in seperate calculation groups. If an extension item appears as a child calculation of LesseeOperatingLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue then no error is produced. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

9375.message:
The element {name} with a value of {sumValue} should be equal to the sum of FinanceLeaseLiability plus FinanceLeaseLiabilityUndiscountedExcessAmount. The value of these adds to {addendValue}.  A difference of {differenceValue}. In an annual filing this reconciliation is required and all elements should have a value in the current reporting period.  

If the difference is due to an extension reconciliation item, then the filer should add a calculation relationship. The calculation tree should show the parent element as FinanceLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue with children of FinanceLeaseLiabilityUndiscountedExcessAmount + FinanceLeaseLiability + any extension items. There should already be a calculation tree defined for the components of FinanceLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue comprised of FinanceLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDueNextTwelveMonths +  FinanceLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDueYearTwo etc.  These two beakdowns of FinanceLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue should be in seperate calculation groups. If an extension item appears as a child calculation of FinanceLeaseLiabilityPaymentsDue then no error is produced. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0091.name: Invalid Value for Percentage Items
description: DQC.US 0091 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
axis, array of allowable-primary-item names
tolerance: integer representing 10**-leastDecimals*tolerance for equality margin)
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0091/DQC_0091.md
DQC.US.0091.message:
The element {name} with a value of {value} has a value greater than a 1,000 percent.  Percentage items should have a value that are generally between 0 and 1. In XBRL a value of 1 is equal to 100%. Please review the value of the element to ensure that it is scaled correctly.  For example 200 basis points should be reported as 0.02. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0095.name: Scale - Common Stock Outstanding
description: DQC.US 0095 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0095/DQC_0095.md
DQC.US.0095.message:
The element {name} with a value of {value} is different than the value reported for the concept {name2} with a value of {value2} by a factor of greater than 100 times. If the difference is the result of a stock split then tag either the element StockIssuedDuringPeriodSharesStockSplits, StockIssuedDuringPeriodSharesReverseStockSplits or the element StockholdersEquityNoteStockSplitConversionRatio1. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0098.name: Liability Revenue Recognized
description: DQC.US 0098 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0098/DQC_0098.md

9531.name: ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized
9531.message:
The element (name) with a value of {value} is greater than the opening balance of {name2} with an opening balance of {value2} on {startDate}. The element {name} represents the amount from the opening balance that was recognized during the period. For this reason it cannot be greater than the opening balance.  

If representing the revenue recognized during the period as part of a rollforward including the revenue recognized from the opening balance use the extension concept ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognizedIncludingOpeningBalance. If reporting the revenue recognized during the period that excludes the opening balance use the extension element ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognizedExcludingOpeningBalance. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

9532.name: ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized
9532.message:
The element {name} with a value of {value} is greater than the opening balances of {name2} and {name3} combined which have an aggregate opening balance of {value2} on {startDate}. The element {name} represents the amount from the opening balance that was recognized during the period. For this reason it cannot be greater than the opening balance.  

If representing the revenue recognized during the period as part of a rollforward including the revenue recognized from the opening balance use the extension concept ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognizedIncludingOpeningBalance. If reporting the revenue recognized during the period that excludes the opening balance use the extension element ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognizedExcludingOpeningBalance. 

The properties of this {name} fact are: 
Context: {contextID} 
Unit: {unitID}.

DQC.US.0099.name: FS with No Associated Calculation
description: DQC.US 0099 rule entries are formatted is as follows:
A JSON object with key that is the rule id and value object as follows:
based on: https://github.com/DataQualityCommittee/dqc_us_rules/blob/master/docs/DQC_US_0099/DQC_0099.md
DQC.US.0099.CF-message-coda: If the item is an additional disclosure in the cash flow statement then make sure that is included as a child of one of the following abstract items: {nonCFabstracts}
DQC.US.0099.nonCF-message-coda: If the item is an additional disclosure in the income statement statement then make sure that is included as a child of one of the following abstract items: ShareBasedCompensationAllocationAndClassificationInFinancialStatementsAbstract, SupplementalIncomeStatementElementsAbstract
